sub_title: Information Security Expat | Information Security Officer and Business Continuity Manager at Achmea Australia | Advisory Council and Supervisory Board Member at Information Security Forum
summary:
As an Information Security Professional with over 20 years of experience, I started out as a hacker in my late teens. The reason for this was because I was hacked myself and it left me feeling vulnerable. I wanted to learn how to prevent this from ever happening again, so I began to study the methods and techniques used by hackers.

My transition to the corporate world happened when I became a Security Specialist, where I honed my skills in vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and incident response. I then advanced to the role of Information Security Manager, where I developed and implemented comprehensive security policies and procedures for the organization.

Following this role, I then became an Information Security Officer and then a Group Information Security Officer, where I worked in a team of security professionals that oversaw the security strategy for the entire organization.

Currently, I am an information security expat on a 2 year assignment in Sydney, Australia where I continue to bring my expertise to an international setting. Throughout my career, I have developed a deep understanding of the challenges and complexities of information security, and I am committed to staying at the forefront of this ever-evolving field.

My experience and knowledge have allowed me to develop a comprehensive approach to information security, ensuring that all aspects of an organization's information systems are protected. I am passionate about sharing my expertise and helping organizations develop their own information security strategies, so they can confidently navigate the digital landscape.

[{'company': {'id': 3534875, 'name': 'Achmea Australia', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQHf9aMpRa4RMA/company-logo_400_400/0/1658313082103?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=MJpJAaUss9cP3qpE25o-x7Ph6AdHJHuUaQzDnBElw3c', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/achmea-australia/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sydney, Nieuw-Zuid-Wales, Australië', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2023}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Achmea Australia', 'description': 'A Business Continuity Manager is responsible for ensuring that a business can continue to operate during and after a disruption. They develop and implement strategies to minimize the impact of a disruption on business operations, including financial loss, reputational damage, and regulatory non-compliance.

The primary responsibility of a Business Continuity Manager is to create and maintain a Business Continuity Plan (BCP). This plan includes all necessary procedures and strategies to minimize the impact of a disruption on business operations. The BCP should be regularly updated and tested to ensure its effectiveness.

To achieve this goal, the Business Continuity Manager must identify potential risks that could disrupt business operations, including natural disasters, cyber-attacks, and supply chain disruptions. They must also establish a crisis management team that can respond quickly and effectively to a disruption. This team should include key stakeholders and subject matter experts.

During a disruption, the Business Continuity Manager coordinates response efforts to ensure that all response efforts are coordinated and communicated regularly with stakeholders and the crisis management team. They must ensure that the BCP complies with all applicable laws and regulations.

In addition, the Business Continuity Manager conducts training and awareness programs for all employees to ensure they understand their roles and responsibilities in the event of a disruption. This training helps to ensure that employees can respond effectively to a disruption and minimize its impact on business operations.

In summary, a Business Continuity Manager plays a critical role in ensuring that a business can continue to operate in the event of a disruption. They are responsible for developing and implementing a BCP, identifying potential risks, establishing a crisis management team, coordinating response efforts, ensuring compliance, and conducting training and awareness programs.', 'title': 'Business Continuity Manager', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Sydney, Nieuw-Zuid-Wales, Australië', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Achmea Australia', 'description': "This is a two year international assignment from Achmea Group in the Netherlands to Achmea Australia.

The role of the Information Security Officer is to design and enforce policies and procedures that protect our organisation's IT infrastructure and business application systems from all forms of cyber security threats. You will be responsible for identifying vulnerabilities, working within our IT department to resolve them, ensuring that our network and data remains secure. You will also be responsible for delivering security risk assessments and improving our cyber security maturity and compliance.

The Information Security Officer has expert analytical skills and an in-depth knowledge of best practices to prevent a wide range of security threats. You also have excellent communication skills, able to train and educate our staff in various information security topics, and work closely with the Senior Leadership Team, Service Delivery, and Project Managers.", 'title': 'Information Security Officer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 55604, 'name': 'Information Security Forum', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEw17HK826zrg/company-logo_400_400/0/1609947046532?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=Ncb8YHnfqXsS_QiYL0Jja0xKxDKzrFk90xC-HE4Z-yc', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/information-security-forum/', 'employees': {'start': 51, 'end': 200}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Londen, Engeland, Verenigd Koninkrijk', 'date': {'start': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Information Security Forum', 'description': 'Supervisory Board Membership is a Board of Directors “like” role. They contribute to a broad range of business activities and matters of importance to Member colleagues.

Members of the Supervisory Board, who are also Directors of Information Security Forum Limited (ISF Limited) and ISF America Inc, play a key role in governing the ISF. They are involved in setting strategy, agreeing key policies, the budget, overseeing finance, risk management and ensuring legal compliance. They also act as Directors of ISF Limited, which holds ISF’s Intellectual Property and is a UK limited company. ISF America Inc was formed in 2010 and Directors are responsible for business matters: administration, finance, business development, strategy, legal and compliance. Supervisory Board Members earn the respect and exercise authority invested in them by the Advisory Council and Members.', 'title': 'ISF Supervisory Board Member', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Londen, Engeland, Verenigd Koninkrijk', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': None, 'day': None, 'year': None}}, 'company': 'Information Security Forum', 'description': 'Advisory Council Members represent the views of ISF Members generally and also their local Chapter.

The purpose of the Advisory Council is to:
•	Be responsible for ensuring high levels of engagement and participation across the Chapters.
•	Represent all Members and be the primary conduit for communicating Company matters across Chapters.
•	Play an active role on ISF Live, including the shaping and scoping of topics for research on behalf of the Membership.
•	Work closely with and support the ISF’s senior leadership team.
•	Influence the Constitution content in readiness for Member voting and approve and ratify Protocol changes tabled by the Supervisory Board and Advisory Council.
•	Be responsible for preserving and upholding the key components of the Forum’s identity.
•	Assess the need for specific practices and procedures to safeguard intellectual property from time to time.

Advisory Council Members will be called upon to demonstrate leadership to other Members, advocating the use of ISF products and services and making a significant contribution to helping the ISF achieve its goals.', 'title': 'ISF Advisory Council Member', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': 162261, 'name': 'Achmea', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQGNTooE2smLUw/company-logo_400_400/0/1519904598323?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=QWNrxjhNn0TTc_XL5QbIp6wmBZ88KysRDiuRYqi389k', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/achmea/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Apeldoorn, Gelderland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2021}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Achmea', 'description': None, 'title': 'Information Risk Manager at Achmea International', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}, {'location': 'Apeldoorn, Gelderland, Nederland', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2022}}, 'company': 'Achmea', 'description': 'Johan is Group Information Security Officer at Achmea, the largest Insurance company in the Netherlands.
